inclusion.criterion: Confidentiality will be preserved to the fullest extent.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The study will be explained to each volunteer in detail. Signing of an Informed Consent Form will be requested for participation in the study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Volunteers will sign the informed consent at the beginning of the study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The Principal Investigator (PI) and/or Co-PIs of the study will be available to answer any questions the volunteer may have.

inclusion.criterion: Consent can be withdrawn at any time.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The investigators will access personal Medical Information (PMI) for study purposes.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: There is no randomization in this interventional physiological study. All patients will receive the same procedures in the same order.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Biostatistical analysis: A de-identified code will be assigned to the patient and registered on a dedicated enrollment log.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The baseline study volunteer data (vital signs and biochemical measurements) will be collected from the MGH electronic medical chart (EPIC).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Prospective collection of patient data will include specific data sheet.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: claustrophobia, he/she may leave the trial at any point.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: The most common side effects of facemask are pressure related, such as redness, irritation over the mask's borders.

notes: Patient has a history of claustrophobia and may be triggered by the use of tents or facemasks. However, they will be continuously monitored for hypoxia and clinical condition to limit risk of unintended hypoxia or hypercarbia.
